excerpt: A plant-based version of the classic Middle Eastern street food.
instructions: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt. Pulse until everything is well combined but still slightly chunky.
Add the flour and baking powder to the chickpea mixture and pulse again until just combined.
Form the mixture into small balls (about 1 1/2 tablespoons each) and flatten them slightly into patties.
Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the patties to the pan and cook until golden brown and crisp on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve the falafel hot with your favorite toppings, such as hummus, tahini sauce, or tabbouleh.
